result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Velez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees. Court waived all non-mandatory costs, fees, surcharges (including DNA surcharge) and assessments due to defendant's financial instability.
Any mandatory costs are due by March 13, 2017 or and entry of a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.

Mental health evaluation, treatment as recommended.
Participate and complete OARS program.
Cooperate with agent. 
Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Velez in court with attorney Paige Styler for attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Daniel Velez in custody.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

At the parties request, case is calendared for a plea and sentencing hearing on 03/13/2015 at 01:30 p.m. in Room 615 of the Courthouse, Judge Dee presiding.
cab

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Daniel Velez not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea hearing.  Parties still engaged in negotiations.  Joint request for adjournment granted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Daniel Velez not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations; possible transfer to mental health court.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel Velez in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Daniel Velez in custody.  Michael Lonski for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: ERIC  R.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daniel Velez in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Daniel Velez in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
